1.name: Captain America: Civil War
1.description: Political involvement in the Avengers' activities causes a rift between Captain America and Iron Man.

2.name: Spider-man: Homecoming
2.description: Peter Parker balances his life as an ordinary high school student in Queens with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man.

3.name: The Avengers
3.description: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

4.name: Avengers: Age Of Ultron
4.description: When Tony Stark and Bruce Banner try to jump-start a dormant peacekeeping program called Ultron, things go horribly wrong and it's up to Earth's mightiest heroes to stop the villainous Ultron from enacting his terrible plan.

1.name: The Amazing Spider-Man
1.description: With the Parker household desperate for money following the death of Ben Parker, Peter Parker decides to continue in show business as Spider-Man.

2.name: Fantastic Four
2.description: The Fantastic Four is a fictional superhero team appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics. The group debuted in The Fantastic Four #1 (cover dated Nov. 1961), which helped to usher in a new level of realism in the medium.

3.name: The Incredible Hulk
3.description: The Incredible Hulk was a live-action science-fiction drama that ran on CBS from 1978 to 1982. It was created by Kenneth Johnson.

4.name: The Avengers
4.description: The Avengers are a fictional team of superheroes appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics. The team made its debut in The Avengers #1 (cover-dated Sept. 1963), created by writer-editor Stan Lee and artist/co-plotter Jack Kirby.

1.name: The Incredible Hulk
1.description: The Incredible Hulk is an American television series based on the Marvel Comics character The Hulk.

2.name: Spider-man
2.description: Spider-Man, also known as Spider-Man: The Animated Series, is an American animated television series based on the Marvel Comics superhero of the same name.

3.name: Spider-man
3.description: After the death of his Uncle Ben, an intelligent teenager named Peter Parker comes to his own terms of becoming a masked superhero named Spider-Man when he became bitten by a radioactive spider during a school field trip to Oscorp and given spider-like powers.

4.name: The Super Hero Squad Show
4.description: Marvel Super Hero Squad is an American cartoon series by Marvel Animation. It is based on the Marvel Super Hero Squad action figure line from Hasbro, which portray the Avengers, the X-Men, and various other characters of the Marvel Universe in a cartoonish super-deformed-style.

5.name: X-Men
5.description: X-Men, also known as X-Men: The Animated Series, is an American animated television series which debuted on October 31, 1992, in the United States on the Fox Network, as part of its Fox Kids Saturday morning lineup.

6.name: Iron man
6.description: Iron Man, also known as Iron Man: The Animated Series, is an American animated television series based on Marvel Comics' superhero Iron Man.

1.name: Justice League
1.description: Justice League is a 2017 American superhero film based on the DC Comics superhero team of the same name, distributed by Warner Bros. Pictures.

2.name: Wonder Woman
2.description: Wonder Woman is a 2017 American superhero film based on the DC Comics character of the same name, distributed by Warner Bros. Pictures.

3.name: Suicide Squad
3.description: Suicide Squad is a 2016 American superhero film based on the DC Comics antihero team of the same name, distributed by Warner Bros. Pictures.

4.name: Batman vs Superman
4.description: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice is a 2016 American superhero film featuring the DC Comics characters Batman and Superman.

5.name: Man of Steel
5.description: Man of Steel is a 2013 superhero film featuring the DC Comics character Superman. It is a British-American venture[2] produced by Legendary Pictures, DC Entertainment, Syncopy Inc., and Cruel and Unusual Films, and distributed by Warner Bros. Pictures.

1.name: Justice League
1.description: The Justice League is the DC Universe's most powerful and premier superhero team, a strike force comprised of the world's mightiest heroes.

2.name: Aquaman
2.description: Aquaman is a fictional superhero appearing in American comic books published by DC Comics. Created by Paul Norris and Mort Weisinger, the character debuted in More Fun Comics #73 (November 1941).

3.name: Batgirl
3.description: Batgirl is the name of several fictional superheroes appearing in American comic books published by DC Comics, depicted as female counterparts to the superhero Batman.

4.name: Batman
4.description: Batman is an ongoing American comic book series featuring the DC Comics superhero Batman as the main protagonist. The character first appeared in Detective Comics #27 (cover dated May 1939).

5.name: Superman
5.description: Superman is an ongoing American comic book series featuring the DC Comics superhero Superman as the main protagonist.

1.name: Wonder Woman
1.description: Wonder Woman, known from seasons 2-3 as The New Adventures of Wonder Woman, is an American television series based on the DC Comics comic book superhero of the same name.

2.name: Batman
2.description: Batman is a 1960s American live action television series, based on the DC comic book character of the same name. It stars Adam West as Batman and Burt Ward as Robin â€“ two crime-fighting heroes who defend Gotham City from a variety of arch villains.

3.name: The Flash
3.description: The Flash is a 1990 American television series developed by the writing team of Danny Bilson and Paul De Meo that aired on CBS.

4.name: Adventures of Superman
4.description: Adventures of Superman is an American television series based on comic book characters and concepts created in 1938 by Jerry Siegel and Joe Shuster.

5.name: Justice League
5.description: Justice League is an American animated television series which ran from 2001 to 2004 on Cartoon Network. It is part of the DC animated universe.
